page.title: 09Old houses
page.content: In Purleigh is a 16th Century thatched cottage called 'Peppers'. Its name is derived from an old lady who lived there. Everybody in the village called her Granny Pepper,so,when she died,the daughter of next door's owner bought the house and named it Peppers. Peppers has just become a listed building which means it is one of the oldest buildings in Britain. The front door belonged to a church in South Woodham Ferrers and at one time the house was taken to bits.The wooden beams were numbered, and you can still see some of the numbers scratched on.
